intro: Diplopterys peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
